AWARDING AGENCY:  U.S. AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT  CFDA LISTING / ASSISTANCE LISTING:  98.008 -  FOOD FOR PEACE EMERGENCY PROGRAM   CFDA NARRATIVE EXCERPT:  THE PURPOSE OF USAID’S BUREAU FOR HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE (BHA) IS TO PROVIDE LIFE-SAVING HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE—INCLUDING FOOD, NUTRITION, WATER, SHELTER, EMERGENCY HEALTHCARE, AND OTHER CRITICAL AID — TO THE WORLD’S MOST VULNERABLE AND HARDEST-TO-REACH POPULATION AFFECTED BY NATURAL, MAN-MADE AND COMPLEX DISASTER.  BHA IS THE LEAD FEDERAL COORDINATOR FOR INTERNATIONAL DISASTER ASSISTANCE, HARNESSING THE EXPERTISE AND UNIQUE CAPACITIES OF OTHER U.S. GOVERNMENT, NON-U.S. ENTITIES & PUBLIC INTERNATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS TO EFFECTIVELY RESPOND TO NATURAL DISASTERS, COMPLEX CRISES BY PROVIDING EMERGENCY AND FOOD ASSISTANCE AROUND THE WORLD.    RECIPIENT:  WORLD FOOD PROGRAMME (WFP)    THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR WFP’S PROGRAM IN NIGER.   SPECIFICALLY, THIS AWARD WILL SUPPORT BENEFICIARIES IN THE NIGER AFFECTED BY ACUTE EMERGENCY FOOD INSECURITY BY:  ¿ APPROVING A CONTRIBUTION OF 4,990 METRIC TONS (MT) OF FY 23 TITLE II COMMODITIES, INCLUDING: CORN SOY BLEND, SUPER CEREAL PLUS BOX-10/1.5 KG., EMERGENCY FOOD, RUSF, POUCH-105/100 G, LENTILS BAG-50 KG. , NOV. OIL VEGETABLE CAN-6/4L, RICE FORTIFIED 5/20 LG. W-MLD BAG 50 KG. CONSISTING OF 4,650 MT OF COMMODITIES TRANSFERRED FROM USDA, AND THE TRANSFER OF 340 MT OF PREPOSITIONED COMMODITIES;  ¿ OBLIGATING $1,749,419 IN INTERNAL TRANSPORT, STORAGE, AND HANDLING (ITSH) FUNDS; AND  ¿ OBLIGATING $925,396 IN SECTION 202(E) FUNDS.
APPROVAL OBLIGATION OF FY23 202E & ITSH FUNDS.   CONTROL NUMBER GENERATED: AF20232653

AWARDING AGENCY:  U.S. AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT    CFDA LISTING / ASSISTANCE LISTING:  98.008 -  FOOD FOR PEACE EMERGENCY PROGRAM     CFDA NARRATIVE EXCERPT:  THE PURPOSE OF USAID’S BUREAU FOR HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE (BHA) IS TO PROVIDE LIFE-SAVING HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE—INCLUDING FOOD, WATER, SHELTER, EMERGENCY HEALTHCARE, AND OTHER CRITICAL AID— TO THE WORLD’S MOST VULNERABLE AND HARDEST-TO-REACH POPULATION AFFECTED BY NATURAL, MAN-MADE AND COMPLEX DISASTER.  BHA IS THE LEAD FEDERAL COORDINATOR FOR INTERNATIONAL DISASTER ASSISTANCE, HARNESSING THE EXPERTISE AND UNIQUE CAPACITIES OF OTHER U.S. GOVERNMENT, NON-U.S. ENTITIES & PUBLIC INTERNATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS TO EFFECTIVELY RESPOND TO NATURAL DISASTERS, COMPLEX CRISES BY PROVIDING EMERGENCY AND FOOD ASSISTANCE AROUND THE WORLD.    BHA TAKES A HOLISTIC APPROACH AT HUMANITARIAN AID, PROVIDING ASSISTANCE BEFORE, DURING AND AFTER A CRISIS—FROM READINESS AND RESPONSE TO RELIEF AND RECOVERY. THIS INCLUDES NON-EMERGENCY PROGRAMMING THAT IS FOUNDATIONAL TO LINKING HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE TO LONG-TERM DEVELOPMENT AND THE JOURNEY TO SELF-RELIANCE.    RECIPIENT – WORLD FOOD PROGRAM (UNWFP)       THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR WFP’S PROGRAM IN   SPECIFICALLY, THIS AWARD WILL PROVIDE FOOD AND NUTRITION ASSISTANCE SUPPORT TO BENEFICIARIES IN NORTHEAST NIGERIA BY:  1)  APPROVING A CONTRIBUTION OF 2,080 METRIC TONS (MT) OF FY 22 TITLE II COMMODITIES, INCLUDING CORN-SOY BLEND PLUS (BAG-HP-25 KG) AND EMERGENCY FD, RUSF (POUCH-105/100G) COMMODITIES TRANSFERRED FROM USDA.    2)  OBLIGATING $2,385,276 IN INTERNAL TRANSPORT, STORAGE, AND HANDLING (ITSH) FUNDS; AND  3)  OBLIGATING $894,354 IN SECTION 202(E) FUNDS.
TO PROVIDE TII FUNDING TO COMBAT FOOD INSECURITY FOR VULNERABLE POPULATIONS IN CAR.

AWARDING AGENCY:  U.S. AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT    CFDA LISTING / ASSISTANCE LISTING:  98.008 –  FOOD FOR PEACE EMERGENCY PROGRAM (EP)    CFDA NARRATIVE EXCERPT:  THE PURPOSE OF USAID’S BUREAU FOR HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE (BHA) IS TO PROVIDE LIFE-SAVING HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE—INCLUDING FOOD, WATER, SHELTER, EMERGENCY HEALTHCARE, AND OTHER CRITICAL AID— TO THE WORLD’S MOST VULNERABLE AND HARDEST-TO-REACH POPULATION AFFECTED BY NATURAL, MAN-MADE AND COMPLEX DISASTER.  BHA IS THE LEAD FEDERAL COORDINATOR FOR INTERNATIONAL DISASTER ASSISTANCE, HARNESSING THE EXPERTISE AND UNIQUE CAPACITIES OF OTHER U.S. GOVERNMENT, NON-U.S. ENTITIES & PUBLIC INTERNATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS TO EFFECTIVELY RESPOND TO NATURAL DISASTERS, COMPLEX CRISES AND FOOD INSECURITY AROUND THE WORLD.  BHA TAKES A HOLISTIC LOOK AT HUMANITARIAN AID, PROVIDING ASSISTANCE BEFORE, DURING AND AFTER A CRISIS—FROM READINESS AND RESPONSE TO RELIEF AND RECOVERY. THIS INCLUDES NON-EMERGENCY PROGRAMMING THAT IS FOUNDATIONAL TO LINKING HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE TO LONG-TERM DEVELOPMENT AND THE JOURNEY TO SELF-RELIANCE.    RECIPIENT – WORLD FOOD PROGRAMME (WFP)    THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR WFP’S PROGRAM IN MADAGASCAR.  SPECIFICALLY, THIS AWARD WILL PROVIDE FOOD AND NUTRITION ASSISTANCE TO VULNERABLE POPULATIONS AFFECTED BY CRISIS AND NATURAL DISASTERS IN MADAGASCAR BY:  A)  APPROVING A CONTRIBUTION OF 13,090 METRIC TONS (MT) OF FY 22 TITLE II COMMODITIES, INCLUDING CORN-SOY BLEND, SUPER CEREAL PLUS (BOX), EMERGENCY FD, RUSF (POUCH), OIL, VEGETABLE (CAN), PEAS, YELLOW, SPLIT (BAG), SORGHUM BULK (BAG) (CONSISTING OF 11,450 MT OF COMMODITIES TRANSFERRED FROM USDA, AND THE TRANSFER OF 1,640 MT OF PREPOSITIONED COMMODITIES);  B)  OBLIGATING $3,733,298 IN INTERNAL TRANSPORT, STORAGE, AND HANDLING (ITSH) FUNDS; AND  C)  OBLIGATING $2,012,220 IN SECTION 202(E) FUNDS.

RECIPIENT:  WORLD FOOD PROGRAMME (WFP)    THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR WFP’S PROGRAM IN NIGER.  SPECIFICALLY, THIS AWARD WILL SUPPORT BENEFICIARIES AND PROVIDE AN INTEGRATED FOOD AND NUTRITION ASSISTANCE TO CRISIS-AFFECTED POPULATIONS (REFUGEES, IDPS, HOST COMMUNITIES AND RETURNEES) IN NIGER BY:  A)  APPROVING A CONTRIBUTION OF 3,960 METRIC TONS (MT) OF FY 22 TITLE II COMMODITIES, INCLUDING CORN-SOY BLEND, SUPER CEREAL PLUS (BOXES), EMERGENCY FD, RUSF (POUCHES), CORN SOY BLEND PLUS (BAGS), LENTILS (BAGS), VEGETABLE OIL (CANS), FORTIFIED RICE (BAGS) (CONSISTING OF 2,840 MT OF COMMODITIES TRANSFERRED FROM USDA, AND THE TRANSFER OF 1,120 MT OF PREPOSITIONED COMMODITIES);  B)  OBLIGATING $1,295,725 IN INTERNAL TRANSPORT, STORAGE, AND HANDLING (ITSH) FUNDS; AND  C)  OBLIGATING $696,204 IN SECTION 202(E) FUNDS.
